circumstances: Just after takeoff from McAllen-Miller Airport, while in initial climb, the left engine failed. The airplane rolled to the left then lost height and crashed in flames. The pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Failure of the left engine during initial climb, stall and uncontrolled descente. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Water in fuel,
- Failed to maintain flying speed, 
- Aircraft last refueled on 21 October 1976 and parked outside, 
- No witnesses observed preflight inspection.
